chemoreception.notes: Nematodes generally rely heavily on chemoreception for orientation, feeding, and mate finding in their marine environment. This is inferred based on general nematode biology.

mechanoreception.notes: Nematodes use mechanoreception to sense touch, pressure, and movement in their environment. This is inferred based on general nematode biology.

vision.notes: Vision is generally absent in nematodes, though some exceptions exist. It is unlikely to be a defining feature of this family.
